CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week.... What Does 'License' Mean to Liquor Control Board? 1951 Liquor Laws Governing State Liquor Control Board - Carron [Carrone] Baptist Church...Mayor questions this situation in Homewood."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 29, 1958, pg. 6, reads: "11 Taverns in Five Blocks - Six of the 11 liquor dispensing establishments between Brushton and Lang Aves., on Frankstown Ave., a five-block area, are...(bottom right picture): Weiss' Tavern at the corner of Lang and Frankstown Ave. ... - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Two story brick building with Weiss Tavern, at intersection of North Lang Avenue, with Carrone Baptist Church in background, 7101 Frankstown Avenue, Homewood
